sites.name: Diocletian's Palace
sites.description: Split's most iconic landmark, this massive palace complex was built by Roman Emperor Diocletian in the 4th century AD. The palace covers 30,000 square meters and includes the emperor's residence, military barracks, and religious buildings. Today, it's a living monument where people still live and work within its ancient walls. The palace features the Peristyle (central square), the Cathedral of Saint Domnius (originally Diocletian's mausoleum), and numerous Roman architectural elements. This UNESCO World Heritage site is the heart of Split's Old Town and offers visitors a unique blend of ancient history and modern life.
sites.seasonal_notes: Summer months are extremely busy with cruise ship visitors. Spring and fall offer pleasant weather and fewer crowds. Winter provides a peaceful experience with mild temperatures. Early morning visits avoid both crowds and the intense midday sun.
sites.booking_tips: No entrance fee required for the palace grounds. Guided tours are available and recommended to understand the complex history. The palace is pedestrian-only and perfect for leisurely exploration. Best to visit early morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds and heat.

sites.name: Riva (Waterfront Promenade)
sites.description: Split's vibrant waterfront promenade stretches along the Adriatic Sea and serves as the city's social and cultural center. This pedestrian-only area is lined with palm trees, cafes, restaurants, and historic buildings. The Riva is where locals gather for coffee, evening strolls, and socializing. The promenade offers spectacular views of the harbor, nearby islands, and the Marjan hill. It's particularly magical in the evening when the lights reflect on the water and the atmosphere becomes lively with street performers and outdoor dining.
sites.seasonal_notes: Summer brings large crowds and cruise ship visitors. Spring and fall offer a more authentic experience. Winter provides a peaceful atmosphere with fewer tourists. The promenade is most atmospheric in the early morning or evening when cruise ship crowds have dispersed.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit early morning or evening to avoid cruise ship crowds. The promenade is pedestrian-only and perfect for leisurely strolls. Many cafes and restaurants line the waterfront, making it ideal for dining and people-watching.

sites.name: Cathedral of Saint Domnius
sites.description: Originally built as Diocletian's mausoleum in the 4th century, this cathedral was converted to a Christian church in the 7th century. The cathedral combines Roman, Byzantine, and medieval architectural elements, featuring a distinctive octagonal structure and a beautiful bell tower. The interior houses religious art, including works by local and Italian artists. The cathedral's architecture reflects Split's complex history from Roman times through the Middle Ages.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round for worship and visitors. Summer brings many tourists. Winter offers a more peaceful experience. The cathedral is particularly atmospheric during religious services. The bell tower has separate opening hours and admission fee.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid queues during peak season. Dress respectfully as this is an active place of worship. The bell tower requires a separate ticket. Photography is permitted but flash is not allowed. Allow 30-45 minutes for a visit.

sites.name: Peristyle
sites.description: The central square of Diocletian's Palace, this magnificent space was the heart of the Roman palace complex. Surrounded by Corinthian columns and featuring the Cathedral of Saint Domnius, the Peristyle is one of the most impressive Roman architectural ensembles in the world. The square is still used for cultural events, concerts, and performances, maintaining its role as a gathering place for over 1,700 years.
sites.seasonal_notes: Summer brings many tourists and cultural events. Spring and fall offer pleasant weather and fewer crowds. Winter provides a peaceful experience. The square is particularly atmospheric during evening cultural events.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit early morning or evening to avoid crowds. The square is pedestrian-only and perfect for photography. Cultural events are often held here in summer months.

sites.name: Marjan Hill
sites.description: This forested hill rises 178 meters above Split and offers the most spectacular panoramic views of the city, Old Town, and surrounding islands. Visitors can reach the summit by hiking, cycling, or driving. The hill features walking paths, viewpoints, a small zoo, and the historic Church of Saint Nicholas. The views are particularly stunning at sunrise and sunset, making it a favorite spot for photographers and nature lovers.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round but may be slippery in wet weather. Summer offers the longest daylight hours. Winter provides clear views but shorter daylight hours. Sunset visits offer the most dramatic lighting for photography.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. The hike to the top takes about 30 minutes and is moderately challenging. Wear comfortable walking shoes. The hill is perfect for a morning jog or evening stroll.

sites.name: Bacvice Beach
sites.description: Split's most popular beach, located just a short walk from the Old Town, offers crystal-clear waters and a vibrant atmosphere. The beach features fine sand, shallow waters perfect for swimming, and numerous beach bars and restaurants. Bacvice is famous for being the birthplace of picigin, a traditional Croatian ball game played in shallow water. The beach is particularly beautiful at sunset when the Old Town is illuminated.
sites.seasonal_notes: Summer is the most popular time with warm water temperatures. Spring and fall offer pleasant swimming conditions with fewer crowds. Winter is too cold for swimming but offers peaceful walks along the beach.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring your own towels and beach gear. Beach bars and restaurants are available but can be expensive. The beach can get crowded during peak season. Arrive early to secure a good spot.

sites.name: Split Archaeological Museum
sites.description: The oldest museum in Croatia, founded in 1820, houses an extensive collection of artifacts from Split's Roman and medieval periods. The museum features Roman sculptures, mosaics, coins, and everyday objects from Diocletian's era. The collection provides insight into Split's rich history and the daily life of its Roman inhabitants.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Summer brings higher visitor numbers, especially families. Winter offers a quieter experience. The museum is a good option for rainy days.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid queues during peak season. Allow 1-1.5 hours for a visit. The museum is relatively small but informative. Audio guides available in multiple languages.

sites.name: Game of Thrones Walking Tour
sites.description: Split served as a filming location for Daenerys Targaryen's throne room and other scenes in HBO's Game of Thrones. This guided tour takes visitors to the actual filming locations around Diocletian's Palace, including the cellars, Peristyle, and various streets. Guides provide behind-the-scenes information and show photos from the filming process. The tour combines entertainment with historical information about Split.
sites.seasonal_notes: Available year-round but most popular during peak tourist season. Summer tours can be crowded. Spring and fall offer pleasant weather for walking. Winter provides a more intimate experience with smaller groups.
sites.booking_tips: Book online in advance, especially during peak season. Tours typically last 2-3 hours. Wear comfortable walking shoes. Tours are available in multiple languages. Some tours include entrance fees to attractions.

sites.name: Split Summer Festival
sites.description: This prestigious cultural festival, held annually from mid-July to mid-August, features classical music, theater, opera, and dance performances in historic venues throughout the Old Town. Performances take place in open-air locations like the Peristyle, Diocletian's cellars, and various squares. The festival has been running since 1954 and attracts world-class artists and performers.
sites.seasonal_notes: Held annually from mid-July to mid-August. Tickets sell out quickly for popular performances. The festival coincides with peak tourist season. Some performances are free, others require tickets.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance, especially for popular performances. Some events are free and held in public squares. Check the festival schedule online. Dress appropriately for evening performances.

sites.name: Diocletian's Cellars
sites.description: These extensive underground chambers beneath Diocletian's Palace were originally used for storage and as a foundation for the palace above. Today, they house shops, galleries, and cultural spaces. The cellars provide insight into Roman engineering and are a popular venue for cultural events and exhibitions. The underground complex is one of the best-preserved examples of Roman architecture in the world.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with constant cool temperature. Summer offers relief from the heat. Winter provides a warm refuge. The cellars are particularly atmospheric during cultural events.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Guided tours are available for deeper historical context. The cellars can be cool, so bring a light jacket. Allow 1 hour for exploration.

sites.name: Fruit Square (Trg Brace Radic)
sites.description: This charming square in the heart of Split's Old Town is surrounded by historic buildings and features a statue of Marko Marulić, Croatia's greatest Renaissance poet. The square is lined with cafes, restaurants, and shops, making it a perfect spot for people-watching and enjoying local cuisine. The square's name comes from the fruit market that was once held here.
sites.seasonal_notes: Summer brings many tourists and outdoor dining. Spring and fall offer pleasant weather and fewer crowds. Winter provides a cozy atmosphere with indoor cafes. The square is most lively in the evening.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit early morning or evening to avoid crowds. The square is pedestrian-only and perfect for leisurely strolls. Many cafes and restaurants offer outdoor seating.

sites.name: Mestrovic Gallery
sites.description: Housed in a villa designed by Croatia's most famous sculptor, Ivan Meštrović, this museum showcases his works in a beautiful setting overlooking the sea. The gallery features sculptures, drawings, and architectural models, providing insight into the artist's creative process and Croatian cultural heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Summer brings higher visitor numbers. Winter offers a quieter experience. The villa's architecture and sea views are highlights.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid queues during peak season. Allow 1-1.5 hours for a visit. The gallery is located outside the Old Town but easily accessible by bus or taxi.

sites.name: Klis Fortress
sites.description: This medieval fortress, located about 10 kilometers from Split, offers spectacular views of the city and surrounding countryside. The fortress played a crucial role in defending the region from Ottoman invasions and was featured in Game of Thrones as the city of Meereen. Today, it houses a museum and provides visitors with insight into Croatia's medieval history.
sites.seasonal_notes: Summer brings many visitors and can be hot. Spring and fall offer pleasant weather and fewer crowds. Winter provides a peaceful experience with dramatic views. The fortress is particularly atmospheric during sunset.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid queues. The fortress is accessible by car or bus from Split. Allow 2 hours for a comprehensive visit. Wear comfortable walking shoes for the steep climb.

sites.name: Trogir
sites.description: This charming medieval town, located about 30 kilometers from Split, is a UNESCO World Heritage site. Trogir features well-preserved Romanesque and Renaissance architecture, including the Cathedral of Saint Lawrence and the Kamerlengo Fortress. The town's narrow streets, historic buildings, and waterfront promenade make it a perfect day trip from Split.
sites.seasonal_notes: Summer brings tourists but is less crowded than Split. Spring and fall offer pleasant weather and a more authentic experience. Winter is quiet and peaceful. The town is accessible year-round by bus or boat from Split.
sites.booking_tips: Reach Trogir by bus from Split or by boat from the harbor. No booking required for general visits. Allow 3-4 hours for a comprehensive visit. The town is perfect for a day trip from Split.

neighborhoods.name: Old Town
neighborhoods.character: A stunning ancient Roman palace complex with medieval additions, limestone streets, and UNESCO World Heritage status, offering a perfect blend of history and modern life.

location.description: The heart of Split, centered around Diocletian's Palace, a massive Roman palace complex where people still live and work within its ancient walls.

history.overview: Built by Roman Emperor Diocletian in the 4th century AD, the palace became the foundation of medieval Split, survived various rulers, and became a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1979.
history.significance: Represents one of the best-preserved Roman palace complexes in the world and the living heart of Split's historic center.
notable_events: Construction of Diocletian's Palace (4th century AD)

practical_info.safety: Very safe, with constant tourist presence and police patrols
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Early morning for photos, afternoon for shopping, evening for dining
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable but with many stairs and uneven surfaces

attractions.name: Diocletian's Palace
attractions.description: Massive 4th-century Roman palace covering 30,000 square meters with perfectly preserved architecture.
attractions.appeal: Explore the living heart of Split where ancient Roman architecture meets modern life.

attractions.name: Peristyle
attractions.description: The central square of Diocletian's Palace, surrounded by Corinthian columns and featuring the Cathedral of Saint Domnius.
attractions.appeal: Experience the most impressive Roman architectural ensemble in the world.

attractions.name: Cathedral of Saint Domnius
attractions.description: Originally Diocletian's mausoleum, converted to a Christian church in the 7th century.
attractions.appeal: Explore the blend of Roman, Byzantine, and medieval architecture in one building.

dining.name: Konoba Fetivi
dining.known_for: Fresh seafood grilled over open fire
dining.atmosphere: Casual waterfront with authentic local experience.

dining.name: Zoi Restaurant
dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated rooftop dining near the palace.

activities.name: Palace Exploration
activities.description: Complete exploration of Diocletian's Palace with its underground cellars, courtyards, and historic buildings.

activities.name: Game of Thrones Tour
activities.description: Visit filming locations from the popular TV series within the palace complex.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the heart of historic Split
You enjoy ancient Roman architecture and atmosphere
You want easy access to all major attractions
avoid_if: You want quiet nights (can be busy with tourists)
insider_tips: Visit the palace early morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds and heat
Explore the underground cellars for a unique perspective on Roman architecture
Many restaurants offer better prices and quality away from the main squares

neighborhoods.name: Varoš
neighborhoods.character: A charming medieval neighborhood with narrow streets, historic churches, and authentic local atmosphere away from the main tourist areas.

location.description: Medieval neighborhood west of Diocletian's Palace, featuring narrow streets, historic churches, and residential areas.

history.overview: Developed as a medieval residential area outside the palace walls, featuring traditional Dalmatian architecture and historic churches.
history.significance: Represents Split's medieval expansion and authentic local life beyond the Roman palace.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with authentic local atmosphere
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for market, afternoon for exploration, evening for dining
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with charming narrow streets

attractions.name: Church of Saint Francis
attractions.description: Beautiful medieval church with Gothic architecture and historic significance.
attractions.appeal: Experience authentic medieval architecture and peaceful atmosphere.

attractions.name: Varoš Market
attractions.description: Traditional daily market offering fresh produce and local products.
attractions.appeal: Experience authentic local life and find fresh ingredients.

attractions.name: Medieval Streets
attractions.description: Narrow cobblestone streets with traditional Dalmatian stone houses.
attractions.appeal: Walk through centuries-old streets with authentic local atmosphere.

dining.name: Konoba Varoš

dining.atmosphere: Simple, traditional restaurant frequented by locals.

activities.name: Local Market Experience

You enjoy medieval architecture and atmosphere
avoid_if: You want to be close to major tourist attractions
You prefer modern amenities and services
insider_tips: Visit the market early morning for the freshest produce and authentic experience
Explore the side streets for hidden gems and local restaurants
Many churches are open for visitors and offer peaceful retreats

neighborhoods.character: A vibrant beach area with crystal-clear waters, beach bars, and a lively atmosphere perfect for swimming and socializing.

location.description: Popular beach area east of the Old Town, featuring the famous Bacvice Beach and surrounding entertainment district.

history.overview: Originally a simple beach area, developed as Split's main recreational destination with modern amenities and entertainment venues.
history.significance: Represents Split's modern beach culture and social gathering place for locals and visitors.

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Summer for beach activities, year-round for dining and nightlife
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with beach promenades and sidewalks

attractions.name: Bacvice Beach

transit: Regular bus service to Old Town

practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with good sidewalks and parks

neighborhoods.name: Marjan
neighborhoods.character: A beautiful hill and nature reserve offering panoramic views, hiking trails, and peaceful green spaces away from the city bustle.

location.description: Large hill and nature reserve west of the Old Town, featuring hiking trails, viewpoints, and natural areas.

history.overview: Originally a strategic lookout point, developed as a nature reserve and recreational area with historic churches and walking paths.
history.significance: Represents Split's natural heritage and provides essential green space for the city.

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Early morning or late afternoon for hiking, sunset for views
practical_info.walkability: Moderately walkable with some steep trails

attractions.name: Marjan Hill

attractions.appeal: Perfect for hiking, photography, and enjoying panoramic views of Split and the Adriatic.

attractions.name: Hiking Trails

attractions.appeal: Excellent hiking opportunities with stunning coastal and city views.

dining.name: Local Picnic Spots

activities.name: Sunset Photography

Bring water and comfortable shoes for hiking trails
Many viewpoints offer perfect spots for picnics with views

The City of Light with its iconic landmarks, world-class museums, romantic atmosphere, and renowned cuisine.
Famous for its art and architecture, especially Gaudí's masterpieces, vibrant cultural scene, and Mediterranean beaches.
The Spanish capital known for its rich repositories of European art, vibrant cultural scene, and excellent cuisine.
Charming coastal capital with historic trams, beautiful viewpoints, and excellent cuisine.
Historic port city with beautiful riverfront, excellent wine culture, and charming old town.
Ancient capital with Acropolis, rich history, excellent museums, and gateway to Greek islands.
Where East meets West with stunning mosques, Grand Bazaar, and rich cultural heritage.
Scandinavian charm with excellent design, beautiful waterfront, and vibrant cultural scene.
Beautiful archipelago setting, excellent museums, and Scandinavian design culture.
Scenic fjord setting, excellent museums, and gateway to Norwegian nature.
Vibrant capital with rich literary heritage, excellent pubs, and friendly atmosphere.
Historic Scottish capital with stunning castle, medieval old town, and vibrant festivals.

activities.name: Walking the City Walls
activities.description: Explore the complete 1.94 km circuit of Dubrovnik's medieval walls, offering spectacular views of the Old Town and Adriatic Sea.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring provides pleasant temperatures and fewer crowds, making it ideal for this iconic activity.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid queues and start early to avoid the midday heat.

activities.name: Cable Car to Mount Srđ
activities.description: Take the cable car to the top of Mount Srđ for panoramic views of Dubrovnik, the Adriatic Sea, and surrounding islands.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers clear visibility and comfortable temperatures for enjoying the spectacular views.
activities.booking_tips: Visit during sunset for the most dramatic views and photography opportunities.

activities.name: Visit to Lokrum Island
activities.description: Explore the beautiful Lokrum Island, a nature reserve with botanical gardens, peacocks, and swimming spots.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is perfect for island visits with mild weather and blooming gardens.
activities.booking_tips: Take the first boat of the day to avoid crowds and bring swimwear for the Dead Sea lake.

activities.name: Game of Thrones Walking Tour
activities.description: Discover filming locations from the popular TV series throughout the Old Town, including the Red Keep and King's Landing scenes.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring weather is ideal for walking tours with comfortable temperatures and good lighting for photos.
activities.booking_tips: Book in advance, especially for popular guides, and bring comfortable walking shoes.

activities.name: Beach Day at Lapad
activities.description: Enjoy the beautiful pebble beaches of Lapad with crystal-clear waters, perfect for swimming and sunbathing.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers warm enough temperatures for swimming while avoiding the summer crowds.
activities.booking_tips: Bring beach towels and arrive early to secure a good spot, especially on weekends.

activities.name: Dubrovnik Summer Festival Preview
activities.description: Experience early performances and preparations for the famous Dubrovnik Summer Festival, which begins in July.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring sees the beginning of cultural season preparations and early performances.
activities.booking_tips: Check the festival schedule for early events and book tickets in advance.

activities.name: Wine Tasting Experience
activities.description: Sample local Croatian wines, particularly Plavac Mali and Pošip, at wine bars throughout the Old Town.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is ideal for wine tasting as the weather is pleasant for both indoor and outdoor venues.
activities.booking_tips: Visit D'vino Wine Bar for an extensive selection of Croatian wines and knowledgeable staff.

activities.name: Photography Tour
activities.description: Capture the beauty of Dubrovnik's architecture, sea views, and historic sites with professional photography guidance.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring light is perfect for photography with golden hour providing ideal conditions.
activities.booking_tips: Book a professional photographer for the best results and access to exclusive locations.

activities.name: Market Shopping in Gruž
activities.description: Explore the daily market in Gruž for fresh local produce, seafood, and authentic Croatian products.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring markets are bustling with fresh seasonal produce and local specialties.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early for the best selection and bring cash for local vendors.

activities.name: Dubrovnik Summer Festival
activities.description: Experience the world-famous Dubrovnik Summer Festival featuring classical music, theater, and dance performances in historic venues.
activities.seasonal_notes: The festival runs from mid-July to late August, showcasing culture in stunning historic settings.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance as performances sell out quickly, especially for popular shows.

activities.name: Beach Hopping
activities.description: Visit multiple beaches including Banje Beach, Copacabana, and hidden coves for swimming and water sports.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers perfect conditions for beach activities with warm water and long daylight hours.
activities.booking_tips: Start early to avoid crowds and bring water shoes for pebble beaches.

activities.name: Boat Tour to Elaphiti Islands
activities.description: Take a boat tour to the beautiful Elaphiti Islands (Koločep, Lopud, Šipan) for swimming, hiking, and island exploration.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer provides ideal conditions for island hopping with calm seas and warm weather.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours in advance and bring snorkeling gear for underwater exploration.

activities.name: Water Sports at Copacabana Beach
activities.description: Enjoy water sports including jet skiing, paddleboarding, and parasailing at the popular Copacabana Beach.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers perfect conditions for water sports with warm water and calm seas.
activities.booking_tips: Book activities in advance, especially for popular sports like jet skiing.

activities.name: Sunset Dinner at Restaurant 360°
activities.description: Enjoy fine dining with panoramic views at Restaurant 360°, located on the city walls with spectacular sunset views.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are perfect for rooftop dining with warm temperatures and stunning sunsets.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve a table well in advance, especially for sunset dining, and request a window seat.

activities.name: Café Buža Cliff Jumping
activities.description: Visit the famous cliff bar Café Buža for drinks and the opportunity to jump into the crystal-clear Adriatic Sea.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer provides warm water temperatures perfect for swimming and cliff jumping.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early to secure a spot and be cautious when jumping - check water depth first.

activities.name: Open-Air Cinema at Fort Lovrijenac
activities.description: Watch classic films under the stars at the historic Fort Lovrijenac with the Old Town as a backdrop.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are perfect for outdoor cinema with warm temperatures and late sunsets.
activities.booking_tips: Bring a blanket or cushion and arrive early to secure a good viewing spot.

activities.name: Seafood Cooking Class
activities.description: Learn to cook traditional Croatian seafood dishes using fresh local ingredients and traditional methods.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer provides the freshest seafood and ideal conditions for culinary learning.
activities.booking_tips: Book classes in advance, especially for popular instructors, and check if market visits are included.

activities.name: Night Swimming at Banje Beach
activities.description: Experience the magic of swimming under the stars at Banje Beach with the illuminated Old Town as a backdrop.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer nights offer warm water temperatures perfect for night swimming.
activities.booking_tips: Bring a towel and be aware of beach access hours and safety considerations.

activities.name: Historical Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore Dubrovnik's rich history with guided tours of the Old Town, focusing on the Republic of Ragusa era.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn provides comfortable temperatures for walking tours with fewer crowds than summer.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours in advance and choose knowledgeable guides for deeper historical insights.

activities.name: Wine Tasting at D'vino Wine Bar
activities.description: Sample Croatian wines including Plavac Mali, Graševina, and Teran at the renowned D'vino Wine Bar.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is harvest season, making it ideal for wine tasting with fresh vintages available.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve a table in advance and ask for wine pairing recommendations with local cheeses.

activities.name: Visit to Rector's Palace
activities.description: Explore the historic Rector's Palace, once the seat of the Republic of Ragusa, with its impressive architecture and exhibits.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn's cooler days are perfect for indoor museum visits with fewer tourists.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid queues and consider a guided tour for historical context.

activities.name: Photography Workshop
activities.description: Join a photography workshop to capture Dubrovnik's autumn beauty with professional guidance and tips.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn light is perfect for photography with golden hour providing ideal conditions.
activities.booking_tips: Book workshops in advance and bring your own camera equipment.

activities.name: Cable Car Views of Autumn Colors
activities.description: Take the cable car to Mount Srđ to enjoy panoramic views of Dubrovnik and the surrounding autumn landscape.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn offers beautiful fall colors and comfortable temperatures for enjoying the views.
activities.booking_tips: Visit during golden hour for the most dramatic lighting and photography opportunities.

activities.name: Local Market Shopping
activities.description: Explore local markets for autumn produce, including fresh figs, grapes, and seasonal Croatian specialties.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn markets are filled with seasonal produce and local harvest specialties.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early for the best selection and bring cash for local vendors.

activities.name: Traditional Croatian Cooking Class
activities.description: Learn to cook traditional Croatian dishes using seasonal ingredients and authentic recipes.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn's harvest provides abundant ingredients for learning traditional Croatian cuisine.
activities.booking_tips: Book classes in advance and check if market visits are included in the experience.

activities.name: Beach Walks in Mild Weather
activities.description: Enjoy peaceful walks along Dubrovnik's beaches with comfortable autumn temperatures and fewer crowds.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn provides ideal conditions for beach walks with mild weather and beautiful light.
activities.booking_tips: Bring comfortable walking shoes and a camera for beautiful autumn beach photography.

activities.name: Visit to Dubrovnik Cathedral
activities.description: Explore the beautiful Dubrovnik Cathedral with its impressive architecture and religious art collections.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn offers a peaceful atmosphere for visiting religious sites with fewer tourists.
activities.booking_tips: Check opening hours and dress appropriately for religious sites.

activities.name: Peaceful Old Town Exploration
activities.description: Explore the Old Town during winter when crowds are minimal, allowing for intimate discovery of historic sites.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers the most peaceful experience of the Old Town with minimal tourist crowds.
activities.booking_tips: Dress warmly and wear comfortable walking shoes for exploring the limestone streets.

activities.name: Café Culture in Old Town
activities.description: Experience authentic Croatian café culture in historic cafés throughout the Old Town, enjoying local coffee and pastries.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is perfect for indoor café culture, providing warmth and authentic local experience.
activities.booking_tips: Visit Café Festival for traditional Croatian coffee and beautiful terrace views.

activities.name: Cable Car Winter Views
activities.description: Take the cable car to Mount Srđ for spectacular winter views of Dubrovnik and the Adriatic Sea.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter provides clear visibility and dramatic lighting for photography from the mountain.
activities.booking_tips: Check weather conditions before visiting and dress warmly for the mountain top.

activities.name: Local Market Shopping
activities.description: Explore local markets for winter produce, fresh seafood, and traditional Croatian products with fewer crowds.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter markets offer authentic local experience with seasonal products and local vendors.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early for the best selection and bring cash for local vendors.

activities.name: Traditional Croatian Dining
activities.description: Enjoy traditional Croatian cuisine at local restaurants, featuring hearty winter dishes and local specialties.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is ideal for enjoying hearty Croatian dishes and local comfort food.
activities.booking_tips: Try traditional dishes like peka (slow-cooked meat) and black risotto at local konobas.

activities.name: Photography in Winter Light
activities.description: Capture Dubrovnik's beauty in winter light with dramatic skies and minimal crowds for unique photography opportunities.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter provides dramatic lighting and atmospheric conditions perfect for photography.
activities.booking_tips: Bring warm clothing and arrive early for the best light conditions.

activities.name: Indoor Cultural Activities
activities.description: Participate in indoor cultural activities including museum visits, art exhibitions, and historical presentations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is perfect for indoor cultural activities, providing warmth and educational experiences.
activities.booking_tips: Check museum schedules and book tickets online to avoid queues.

activities.name: Historical Museum Visits
activities.description: Explore Dubrovnik's museums including the Maritime Museum and Ethnographic Museum with minimal crowds.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers peaceful museum visits with fewer tourists and comfortable indoor temperatures.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase museum passes for multiple visits and check opening hours in advance.

activities.name: Seafood Dining at Local Konobas
activities.description: Enjoy fresh seafood at traditional konobas (taverns) featuring local Adriatic specialties and warm hospitality.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter provides the freshest seafood and authentic local dining experiences.
activities.booking_tips: Try local specialties like grilled fish and seafood risotto at family-run konobas.

ranges.notes: Major holiday - most attractions closed, cold weather (5-10°C), post-celebration cleanup, limited transport
considerations: Excellent for photography with fewer crowds

ranges.notes: Post-holiday recovery, gradual reopening, winter season, cold (3-8°C)
considerations: Excellent for peaceful Old Town exploration

ranges.notes: Winter season, cold temperatures (2-7°C), ideal for indoor activities, very low tourism
Winter continues, cold (3-8°C), fewer crowds, excellent museum time
Romantic atmosphere, special dining events, busy restaurants, book 2-3 weeks ahead
Post-Valentine's, winter continues, gradually warming (4-9°C), spring hints
Early spring transition, variable weather (6-13°C), increasing daylight
Spring awakening, pleasant temperatures (8-15°C), perfect for walking
considerations: Perfect time for Old Town exploration

ranges.notes: Spring officially arrives, excellent conditions (10-16°C), cultural events begin
Spring flowers, pleasant temperatures (10-17°C), Easter period
Ideal spring weather, increasing outdoor activities, comfortable temperatures
Perfect spring conditions (12-18°C), comfortable temperatures, ideal sightseeing
Late spring, excellent weather, increasing tourism
Many closures but special events
Excellent spring weather (13-20°C), blooming gardens, outdoor dining
Perfect weather, not peak tourism yet, ideal for sightseeing
Warm weather (14-21°C), outdoor café culture thriving, long days
Excellent weather (16-23°C), long daylight, pre-peak season
Warming up, tourism increasing, still manageable crowds
Longest day of the year, perfect for evening activities
Summer begins, increasing tourism, warm weather (17-24°C)
Peak tourism season, warm weather (18-26°C), crowded attractions
French national holiday, some celebrations, cultural events
Cultural festival, hot weather (19-27°C), peak tourism, crowded
Hot weather (19-27°C), cultural festival, peak tourism, crowded
Still warm, crowds decreasing as European vacations end, more manageable
Excellent post-peak season, warm weather continues (16-23°C), fewer crowds
Pleasant temperatures, reduced crowds, cultural events, ideal conditions
Comfortable temperatures (12-18°C), beautiful autumn atmosphere, golden light
Fall colors, comfortable temperatures, cultural season begins
Holiday, some closures but special cemetery visits
Fall colors continue, cooling temperatures (8-14°C), indoor activities
Museums and indoor activities, cooler weather
Holiday atmosphere, festive decorations, cooler weather
Holiday events, Christmas shopping crowds, festive lights
Many closures but special atmosphere, family celebrations
Between Christmas and New Year's - busy tourist period
Special events but very crowded, celebrations

scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or limited activities, poor value
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very high crowds, limited value
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism, fair value
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds, good value
scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds, best value

valuePricing.strategy: Book 2-3 months ahead for best rates

accommodation.airConditioning: Essential July-August, many historic hotels lack AC

closures.august: Some local restaurants close for owner vacations
closures.holidays: Christmas Day, New Year's Day, May 1st
closures.sunday: Some traditional restaurants closed Sunday evening

monthlyHighlights.january: Winter peace, cozy museums, authentic local experience
monthlyHighlights.february: Valentine's romance, fewer crowds, cultural immersion
monthlyHighlights.march: Spring awakening, perfect temperatures, peaceful exploration
monthlyHighlights.april: Ideal weather, comfortable temperatures, outdoor activities
monthlyHighlights.may: Perfect conditions, optimal sightseeing, manageable crowds
monthlyHighlights.june: Longest days, pre-peak crowds, excellent weather
monthlyHighlights.july: Peak summer, Summer Festival, crowded but exciting
monthlyHighlights.august: Hot weather, Summer Festival continues, peak tourism
monthlyHighlights.september: Post-peak perfection, ideal conditions, cultural events
monthlyHighlights.october: Autumn beauty, comfortable temperatures, cultural season
monthlyHighlights.november: Cozy atmosphere, cultural activities, fewer crowds
monthlyHighlights.december: Holiday magic, festive atmosphere, moderate crowds

weatherNotes.spring: Variable weather, layers recommended, occasional rain
weatherNotes.summer: Warm to hot, occasional heatwaves, evening thunderstorms possible
weatherNotes.autumn: Gradually cooling, beautiful colors, comfortable for walking
weatherNotes.winter: Cold but rarely extreme, occasional rain, indoor activities recommended

transportation.walking: Best in spring and autumn, challenging in extreme weather
transportation.boats: Scenic year-round, limited schedule in winter

accommodation.advanceBooking: Recommended 3-6 months ahead for peak season
